results.purpose: CMA (Customer/Consumer Management Area) squad organization tracker showing team structure, KPIs, leadership, and communication channels
key_data_points: 25+ squads organized across 6 tribes: Shopping Journey, Shopping Foundation, New Ventures, Consumer Core, Consumer Foundations, Engagement, Loyalty & Virality, and UX
Q1 2026 KPIs defined for most squads
Key metrics include: Profile Completion Rate, Add-to-Cart Rates, CLV per Intervention, Self Service Rate, Net Revenue, API-v2 endpoint migration, Daily/Monthly Active User ratios
New Ventures brands tracked: Factor Form, Good Chop, The Pets Table
Multiple squads focused on API-v2 migration (Consumer Core tribe)
Engineering Managers and Product Managers assigned to each squad

entities.name: Factor Form
entities.context: New Ventures squad with Factor Penetration % KPI, managed by Hamed Karimian (PM) and Pantelis Chatzinikolis (EM)

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: New Ventures squad tracking Net Revenue, managed by Beatrice Dimarucut (PM) and Alexander Matlin (EM)

entities.name: The Pets Table
entities.context: New Ventures pet food squad tracking Net Revenue, managed by Maria Chelminska (PM) and Ahmed Wagdi (EM)

entities.name: Fiona Lucas
entities.context: PM overseeing multiple Consumer Core squads (Customers, Plans, Deliveries & Orders, Monoliths)

entities.name: Bartosz Raciborski
entities.context: EM for Personalization squad, start date: 1st Jan, with Amey Patil as interim

entities.name: Maxime Valy
entities.context: EM for Shopping Platform squad, start date: 1st Jan

insights: Organization is undergoing leadership transitions with multiple 'start date: 1st Jan' notations, suggesting Q1 2026 reorganization
Strong focus on API-v2 migration across Consumer Core tribe with KPIs tracking endpoint migration progress
New Ventures tribe diversifying beyond core meal kit business into pet food and meat delivery
Several Jira project links noted as 'Can't find link', indicating documentation gaps
Consumer Foundations squads focus on platform capabilities and developer productivity metrics
Engagement and Loyalty tribes emphasize app-based metrics (downloads, DAU/MAU ratios, recipe saves)
UX tribe (Insights & Innovation, Content Design & Localization) lacks assigned personnel and KPIs, suggesting incomplete planning
Shopping Foundation is the largest tribe with 5 squads covering cart, personalization, customer service, and cross-selling

results.purpose: Tracks CMA (Customer, Menu, and App) organization structure including squads, their KPIs, leadership, and resources for Q1 2026
key_data_points: 25+ squads organized into 7 tribes: Shopping Journey, Shopping Foundation, New Ventures, Consumer Core, Consumer Foundations, Engagement, and Loyalty & Virality
Q1 2026 KPIs defined for most squads
Each squad has assigned PM (Product Manager) and EM (Engineering Manager)
Jira project links and Slack channels for coordination
Mix of business metrics (revenue, conversion rates) and technical metrics (API endpoints, deployment frequency)

entities.name: Fiona Lucas
entities.context: PM for entire Consumer Core tribe (4 squads)

entities.name: Factor Form
entities.context: New Ventures squad focused on Factor75.com penetration

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: New Ventures squad tracking net revenue at goodchop.com

entities.name: The Pets Table
entities.context: New Ventures squad for pet food business at thepetstable.com

entities.name: HelloFresh app
entities.context: Primary mobile application tracked by multiple engagement squads

entities.name: API-v2
entities.context: Technical migration target for Consumer Core squads

entities.name: Jira
entities.context: Project management tool with backlog links for each squad

entities.name: Slack
entities.context: Communication channels assigned per squad

insights: Shopping Foundation is the largest tribe with 5 squads covering cart, personalization, platform, customer service, and cross-selling
New Ventures tribe manages 4 separate brand initiatives (Factor Form, Good Chop, Pets Table, Market Innovation) each with revenue/order KPIs
Consumer Core tribe is undergoing technical modernization with focus on API-v2 migration across customer, subscription, and delivery domains
Engagement and Loyalty squads focus on app activation metrics (downloads, DAU/MAU, recipe saves, mission completion)
Several Jira links are noted as inaccessible ('Can't find link'), indicating potential access control issues
Two squads have EMs with January 1st start dates (Personalization and Shopping Platform), suggesting recent hiring or reorganization
UX tribe (Insights & Innovation, Content Design & Localization) has incomplete information with no assigned personnel or KPIs
Consumer Foundations focuses on developer productivity metrics (deployment frequency, feature velocity) rather than customer-facing KPIs

results.purpose: Tracks CMA (Customer, Menu, and App) organization structure with squad assignments, KPIs, leadership, and technical resources for Q1 2026
key_data_points: 23 squads organized across 7 tribes
Q1 2026 KPIs defined for each squad
Profile Completion Rate (Customer Profile)
Menu Add-to-Cart Rate (Menu Discovery)
Predicted CLV per Intervention (Personalization)
Self Service Rate (Customer Service Experience)
Factor Penetration % (Factor Form)
Net Revenue (Good Chop, The Pets Table)
API-v2 endpoint migration metrics (Consumer Core)
Daily active users to monthly active users ratio (Act squad)
Organic app downloads from sharing features (Share squad)

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Primary brand with app and meal kit service

entities.name: Factor75/Factor Form
entities.context: New venture brand tracked for penetration

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: New venture brand tracked for net revenue

entities.name: The Pets Table
entities.context: New venture pet food brand tracked for net revenue

entities.name: Fiona Lucas
entities.context: PM overseeing multiple Consumer Core squads (Customers, Plans, Deliveries & Orders, Monoliths)

entities.name: Bartosz Raciborski
entities.context: EM for Personalization squad, start date: 1st Jan

entities.name: Maxime Valy

insights: Organization structured into 7 main tribes: Shopping Journey, Shopping Foundation, New Ventures, Consumer Core, Consumer Foundations, Engagement, and Loyalty & Virality
Shopping Foundation is the largest tribe with 5 squads focused on cart, platform, personalization, customer service, and cross-selling
New Ventures tribe manages 4 separate brands (Factor Form, Good Chop, The Pets Table, Market Innovation) with revenue-focused KPIs
Consumer Core focuses on API-v2 migration with consistent KPI of 'number of endpoints with live traffic' across multiple domains
Several Jira backlog links are noted as inaccessible ('Can't find link')
Two new Engineering Managers starting January 1st indicates team expansion
UX tribe (Insights & Innovation, Content Design & Localization) has incomplete information with no PM/EM assignments
Mix of business metrics (revenue, penetration, completion rates) and technical metrics (API endpoints, deployment frequency)
Strong emphasis on customer engagement and retention through Loyalty & Virality tribe with missions, rewards, and sharing features

results.purpose: Tracks CMA (Customer, Menu, and App) squad organization, ownership, KPIs, and resources for Q1 2026
key_data_points: 23 squads organized across 7 tribes (Shopping Journey, Shopping Foundation, New Ventures, Consumer Core, Consumer Foundations, Engagement, Loyalty & Virality, UX)
Q1 2026 KPIs defined for most squads
Product Managers and Engineering Managers assigned to each squad
Jira project links and Slack channels for coordination
Mix of business metrics (revenue, conversion rates) and technical metrics (API endpoints, deployment frequency)

entities.name: Shopping Journey
entities.context: Tribe containing 4 squads focused on customer-facing shopping features (Customer Profile, Menu Discovery, Merchandising, Feedback)

entities.name: Shopping Foundation
entities.context: Tribe with 5 squads handling core shopping infrastructure (Personalization, Cart, Shopping Platform, Customer Service, Cross Selling)

entities.name: New Ventures
entities.context: Tribe managing 4 new business initiatives: Factor Form, Good Chop, The Pets Table, Market Innovation

entities.name: Factor Form
entities.context: New venture tracked by Factor Penetration % KPI, managed by Hamed Karimian and Pantelis Chatzinikolis

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: New venture with Net Revenue KPI at goodchop.com

entities.name: The Pets Table
entities.context: Pet food venture with Net Revenue KPI at thepetstable.com

entities.name: Consumer Core
entities.context: Tribe with 4 squads managing core customer APIs (Customers, Plans, Deliveries & Orders, Monoliths)

entities.name: Fiona Lucas
entities.context: PM for all Consumer Core squads (Customers, Plans, Deliveries & Orders, Monoliths)

entities.name: Consumer Foundations
entities.context: Tribe with 2 squads focused on developer productivity and platform capabilities

entities.name: Engagement
entities.context: Tribe with 2 squads (Inspire, Act) focused on app engagement and recipe features

entities.name: Loyalty & Virality
entities.context: Tribe with 3 squads (Share, Missions, Rewards) managing loyalty program features

insights: Organization follows a tribe/squad model with clear ownership (PM + EM per squad)
Consumer Core tribe is consolidating under single PM (Fiona Lucas) suggesting platform standardization effort
New Ventures squads track revenue-focused KPIs while established squads track engagement/conversion metrics
Consumer Foundations squads measure engineering productivity (deployment frequency, feature velocity) rather than business outcomes
Several squads have broken or inaccessible Jira links ('Can't find link' noted)
Some leadership transitions occurring (Bartosz Raciborski and Maxime Valy both starting January 1st)
UX tribe (Insights & Innovation, Content Design & Localization) lacks complete information - possibly still being formed
Technical modernization focus evident in Consumer Core with KPIs around API-v2 endpoint migration
Strong emphasis on self-service and automation (Self Service Rate KPI, Customer Service Experience squad)
Mobile app engagement is priority with multiple squads tracking app-specific metrics (downloads, DAU/MAU ratio, recipe saves)

insights: Organization structured into 7 main tribes: Shopping Journey, Shopping Foundation, New Ventures, Consumer Core, Consumer Foundations, Engagement, and Loyalty & Virality
Shopping Foundation is the largest tribe with 5 squads focused on cart, personalization, platform, customer service, and cross-selling
New Ventures tribe manages 4 separate brands/products (Factor Form, Good Chop, The Pets Table, Market Innovation)
Consumer Core squads are focused on API-v2 migration with consistent KPI structure across customer, subscription, and delivery domains
Multiple squads have incomplete Jira links noted as 'Can't find link'
Two UX squads (Insights & Innovation, Content Design & Localization) lack PM, EM, and KPI information
Leadership transition noted: Bartosz Raciborski starting Jan 1st for Personalization squad with Amey Patil as interim
Engagement and Loyalty tribes focus on app-based metrics (downloads, active users, recipe saves, sharing features)
All squads have dedicated Slack channels following naming convention #squad-[name] or #cma-squad-[name]

Consumer Foundations emphasizes engineering productivity metrics (deployment frequency, feature velocity)
Engagement and Loyalty & Virality tribes focus on user activation and retention metrics
Several squads have incomplete information (missing Jira links, UX squads missing PM/EM assignments)
Multiple engineering managers are starting in January 2026 (Bartosz Raciborski, Maxime Valy)
Technical domain/TRE links are mostly missing, suggesting documentation gaps
